Inter want to sign world-class duo Kroos and Godin

Italy’s newspapers are full of transfer talk on Monday, and Inter Milan in particular are dominating column inches. Corielle dello Sport claims the Nerazzurri are in talks with not one Madrid club, but two over the transfers of Real’s midfield maestro Toni Kroos and Atleti’s defensive stalwart Diego Godin.

Inter also keen to secure Kovacic’s services

There has been talk of Chelsea trying to make Mateo Kovacic’s loan move to Stamford Bridge permanent, but they are not the only club interested. Inter is keen on the Croatian, if Tuttosport are to be believed.

Real Madrid, Espanyol and Real Betis end 2018 without a red card

Real Madrid, Espanyol and Real Betis managed to go the whole of 2018 without receiving a red card.

The three Spanish sides, as well as Bundesliga club Borussia Monchengladbach, were the only teams on the continent to do so.

Real Madrid’s achievement was made particularly impressive given the fact that they played so many matches across various competitions.

Los Blancos went all the way in the Champions League and competed in the European Super Cup as well as, most recently, the Club World Cup.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/12/30/5c290697468aebb2798b45c6.html

Real Madrid are Mister Universe


Real Madrid were proclaimed world champions by beating Al Ain 4-1 on 22 December, clinching their fourth Club World Cupand taking their total of international titles to a staggering 28, now holding more than any other club on the planet.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/12/30/5c27fc4b468aeb45568b45a6.html

Cristiano Ronaldo: Real Madrid’s top scorer in 2018 despite summer departure

Cristiano Ronaldo may have left Real Madrid in the summer to join Juventus but that has not stopped him from topping Los Blancos’ scoring chart for the calendar year.

The debates over whether Madrid miss their legendary Portuguese forward continue but the statistics speak for themselves, especially when it comes to goals.

Ronaldo ends 2018 on 28 goals for Los Blancos, which is one more than Gareth Bale (27) and ten more than Karim Benzema (18).

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/12/30/5c28f705e2704e277e8b45d2.html

On loan Andriy Lunin opposed to January Bernabéu return

Real Madrid want the Ukrainian stopper back at the club fearing that Costa Rican Keylor Navas may leave in the winter transfer market.

Despite having secured limited first team playing time at his loan club Leganes, Ukrainian stopper Andriy Lunin has requested to stay at Butarque through to the end of the 2018/19 season. Notwithstanding that he is playing understudy to regular goalkeeper "Pichu" Cuéllar, Lunin is happy in his surroundings in the Madrid suburbs where he has forged an excellent relationship with the rest of the "Lega" squad and goalkeeping coach Joseba Ituarte.

https://en.as.com/en/2018/12/31/football/1546248768_621194.html

Real Madrid confirmed that a sciatic nerve injury was being evaluated by the medical team but the player would not travel on Thursday.

Real Madrid have confirmed that striker Mariano Díaz is once again out of action through injury.

The club confirmed that the player has been diagnosed as suffering with "irritation of the sciatic nerve" and is now being treated by the club medical team.

Florentino Perez: Let 2019 be a great year for Real Madrid


Along with the captains of Real Madrid's basketball and football teams, Florentino Perez wanted to wish all Madridistas a very happy new year, a 2019 in which he hopes Los Blancos will be successful once more.

Sergio Ramos shared his president's sentiments as Real go hunting for silverware in the second half of the LaLiga Santander season.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/12/31/5c2a294b268e3e454c8b4613.html

Brahim Diaz is already thinking about Real Madrid: He wants the No.21 shirt


All that appears to be missing from Brahim Diaz's transfer to Real Madrid is an official announcement and the date of his presentation as a Los Blancos player, as everything else seems to be in place.

Real Madrid wishing for good health in 2019


Something that everyone hopes for heading into a new year is health, and that will be top of Real Madrid's list of requests as 2018 becomes 2019, having suffered a total of 43 injuries involving 20 players this calendar year.

If Los Blancos are to go on and win silverware this season, keeping their players fit will be fundamental.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/12/31/5c294f84e5fdeae11d8b45a9.html

Solari: It was a wonderful year for Real Madrid

After their open training session at Valdebebas, Real Madrid coach, Santiago Solari, underlined the importance of the successes achieved by the team in 2018.

Despite both Zinedine Zidane and Cristiano Ronaldo leaving, Solari believed it had still been a great year for Los Blancos.

"It's been a wonderful year for Real Madrid, another one that adds to its history," he said.

"I hope that people celebrate the last night of the year in peace and face 2019 with hope, work and love, which is the most important."

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/12/31/5c2a27ee268e3e67418b45a3.html

Cristiano Ronaldo: Juventus ace Real Madrid's top scorer in 2018

Cristiano Ronaldo may have left Real Madrid for Juve in July, but the Portuguese still tops the LaLiga club's goal charts for the calendar year.

Cristiano Ronaldo will not be seeing in 2019 as a Real Madrid player, but nevertheless remains a dominant figure in the European champions' end-of-year statistics. Despite making his final Madrid appearance in May - before joining Juventus in July - the forward was still Los Blancos' top scorer in 2018, with 28.

James Rodríguez: Juventus set to hold talks with agent in Dubai

Juve sporting director Fabio Paratici is expected to sit down with the Jorge Mendes, the agent of Bayern Munich's on-loan Real Madrid player.

James Rodríguez is again in the Italian media spotlight over Juventus' interest in signing the midfielder, who is currently on loan at Bayern Munich from Real Madrid.

James was recently tipped for a January switch to the Serie A champions, but with such a move now looking all but an impossibility, the Bianconeri are reportedly ready to go all out for the Colombia international at the end of the season.

Juve sporting director set for Mendes talks in Dubai
Tuttosport claims that Juventus sporting director Fabio Paratici will hold talks with the player's agent, Jorge Mendes, at this week's Globe Soccer Awards in Dubai, where both are due to be in attendance.

Indeed, the Turin daily says that the Vecchia Signora are now in pole position to secure the star's services next season, either by signing him from Bayern - who have a 42m-euro purchase option on the 27-year-old - or from parent club Madrid.

Keylor Navas bids farewell?

The Costa Rican stopper posted a message on his Instagram account giving thanks to Real Madrid fans amid rumours of a winter departure.

An Instagram post from Keylor Navas will do little to quell rumours suggesting that the Costa Rican goalkeeper is poised to leave Real Madrid in the winter transfer market.



The message featured the goalkeeper and some of the 8,000 Real Madrid supporters who braved the elements to watch the squad train at Valdebebas as part of the annual open-doors session. "Thanks for everything" was the message from the player that accompanied the image.

Many media outlets have interpreted this message as a farewell from the Costa Rican international. Since Santi Solari's arrival at the Bernabeu, Navas has only started for Madrid in the Copa del Rey tie against Melilla and has been on the bench for all league and Champions League games. The stopper also failed to secure playing time in the recent FIFA Club World Cup and this contributes to the goalkeeper's desire to search for a fresh start.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/01/football/1546339718_310785.html

"I don't know if leaving Chelsea would be good for Hazard"


Belgium head coach Roberto Martinez believes that Eden Hazard may not be suited to a new challenge at Real Madrid and says staying at Chelsea is his best option.

A new project may not suit Hazard - Martinez

“I do not know if a new challenge would be good for him. He knows how much they love him at Chelsea and there's chemistry between Sarri and him. Besides, he is enjoying his time at Chelsea, where he has reached an exceptional level,” said the Spanish coach in an interview with Belgian newspaper HLN.

“It’s uncertain that a new project will suit him. I am convinced that he can reinvent himself at the club”

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/01/football/1546354150_280759.html

Marcos Llorente medical report


Following the tests carried out today on our player Marcos Llorente by the Real Madrid medical team, he has been diagnosed with a grade 2 injury to his left adductor. His recovery will continue to be assessed.

https://www.realmadrid.com/en/news/2019/01/marcos-llorente-medical-report?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=organico

Marcos Llorente out for up to three weeks with muscle tear

Real Madrid have confirmed that Marcos Llorente has suffered a muscle injury in training that could potentially see him miss the club's next six games.

Real Madrid’s Marcos Llorente has picked up a muscular injury during a training session on December 31 and will be out for two to three weeks, the club has confirmed.

While the midfielder carried on with the training session without a problem after the injury occurred, tests carried out on Tuesday revealed a muscle tear in his left adductor.

“Following the tests carried out today on our player Marcos Llorente by the Real Madrid medical team, he has been diagnosed with a grade 2 injury to his left adductor. His recovery will continue to be assessed,” stated the medical report published on the club’s website this Tuesday.

The injury means that Llorente could potentially be unavailable for Los Blancos’ next six games against Villarreal (LaLiga), Real Sociedad (LaLiga), Leganés (Copa del Rey first leg), Betis (LaLiga), Leganés (Copa del Rey second leg) and Sevilla (LaLiga).

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/01/football/1546365830_380358.html

Dani Carvajal, Lucas Vazquez and Nacho share unforgettable Castilla memories


Dani Carvajal, Lucas Vazquez and Nacho were all part of the Real Madrid Castilla side who secured promotion to the Segunda Division in the historic 2011/12 season.

The three, who are all now Real Madrid first team players, got together to remember the best moments from that campaign.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/01/5c2bd0cf22601d9e238b4584.html

Tax Agency sends Xabi Alonso's case to trial in January

Former Real Madrid player Xabi Alonso will appear in court on 22 January to respond to charges of tax evasion.

The Spaniard maintains his innocence and has refused to reach an agreement with the prosecutor's office concerning the alleged defrauding of two million euros through an offshore account based in Madeira, Portugal.

According to El Confidencial, Alonso faces five years in prison, while the State Attorney, who represents the Tax Agency, asks for an additional three years.

The defence, however, trusts that even in case of conviction, the 37-year-old will not be handed a prison sentence.

Bale: From 0 to 100 at Villarreal


Just over five years since his first Real Madrid goal at the home of Villarreal, Gareth Bale returns to the same ground intent on reaching his 100th for Los Blancos.

It was on 14 September 2013 when the Welshman made an instant impact on his Real Madrid debut following his big money move from Tottenham Hotspur, scoring at Estadio de la Ceramica in a 2-2 draw.

As Santiago Solari's side prepare for the first match of 2019, some 2,303 days after Bale's debut goal, the 29-year-old needs just two more to reach a century in the famous white jersey.

Real Madrid: Mariano injury boosts prospect of striker signing

With Mariano Díaz ruled out for the third time since his summer return to Real Madrid. Mauro Icardi and Timo Werner are on the LaLiga club's radar.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/02/football/1546430234_200055.html

Casemiro poised for place in starting line-up against Villarreal

Real Madrid completed their last training session ahead of the Villarreal clash without the injured Marcos Llorente, Asensio and Mariano.

Real Madrid finished final preparations in Valdebebas this morning ahead of the re-arranged LaLiga match away to Villarreal at the Estadio de La Cerámica (Jan 3 at 21:30 CET). With the injury sustained by Marcos Llorente, everything points to Casemiro starting in the line-up. The Brazilian secured some playing time at the recent Club World Cup after his return from injury.

Few other changes are anticipated in the starting XI with Solari expected to start with Courtois in goal, a defense of: Carvajal, Varane, Ramos and Marcelo. Kroos and Modric will accompany the Brazilian in the midfield with a front-line trio of Lucas Vázquez, Benzema and Gareth Bale.

Apart from Marcos Llorente, Solari also has to make do with other key injury-hit absentees in Asensio and Mariano. Youth team player Cristo was called by Solari to complete numbers with the young striker already finding the net for the first team in the Copa del Rey game away to Melilla.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/02/football/1546426590_475807.html

Solari: Real Madrid are going into the Villarreal match with energy and aggression


Real Madrid ended 2018 by winning the Club World Cup and Santiago Solari hopes his side shows similar hunger and desire to win when they play their first match of 2019.

Los Blancos visit Villarreal on Thursday night to play the match from the 17th round that was postponed due to their participation in the FIFA tournament.

"We'll go out to compete," he said of this fixture in Wednesday's pre-match press conference.

"We want the players to be happy and to be excited.

"They are a solid team and we must go into the match with energy and aggression."

Real Madrid often stumble when they begin a year on the road


The alarm bells are ringing for Real Madrid who face Villarreal in their first game of 2019 having won just eight of their 41 games played on the road at the start of a new year.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/02/5c2c7e3a46163f6a158b4591.html

Villarreal will form a guard of honour for Real Madrid


Real Madrid will be welcomed onto the pitch for the first time in 2019 with a guard of honour as Villarreal have confirmed they will respectfully greet the recently crowned world champions.

Last season Barcelona refused to form a guard of honour for Real Madrid at the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu on December 23, 2017, with the Catalans claiming they didn't see it as appropriate as both sides had not competed in the Club World Cup.

Villarreal, though, will participate, as they believe that this is a tradition used to mark the winning of any official competition and last season they provided the same service for Barcelona after they had been crowned LaLiga Santander champions.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/02/5c2cc74d46163f625e8b456a.html

Real Madrid coach Santiago Solari was coy when asked if the World champions would sign any new players in the January transfer window. "It's not for me to talk about the club's transfer strategy," he told a news conference. "That's something that belongs in the private sphere."

Games Marcos Llorente could miss:

• Villarreal
• Real Sociedad
• Leganés
• Real Betis
• Leganés
• Sevilla

Official: Real Madrid sign Mohamed Mizzian


Mizzian's impressive performance for Melilla in the second leg of the Copa del Rey tie against Los Blancos was enough to convince Madrid’s sporting direction to sign him.

Real Madrid have closed the signing of promising youngster Mohamed Mizzian from Second Division B side Melilla.

Barcelona were also understood to be interested in signing in the 18-year-old, but in the end Madrid have secured a loan deal for the player with the option to buy at the end of the season, when his contract with Melilla finalises.

Mizzian has already experienced playing at the Santiago Bernabeu, where his impressive performance for Melilla in the second leg of the Copa del Rey tie against Los Blancos on December 6 was enough to convince Madrid’s sporting direction to sign him.

Madrid were on the verge of closing the signing of the youngster some weeks ago, but the deal had to be put on hold as the player was changing agents.

The young striker will most likely be incorporated in the club’s ‘B’ team, Real Madrid Castilla, but could see himself called up to the first team by coach Santiago Solari to provide cover for the injured Mariano Diaz, should the club not sign another striker in the January transfer window.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/02/football/1546453483_634013.html

SOLARI PLAYS DOWN ISCO EXIT RUMOURS

Real Madrid boss Santiago Solari expects Isco to remain at the club amid rumours the attacking midfielder could leave the Santiago Bernabeu after losing his place in the first team, the Daily Mail are reporting.

Isco has not started a league game since Solari replaced Julen Lopetegui as head coach in October but the Argentine has backed the Spain international to stay and rediscover his best form.

"Every player here has to be committed, dedicated and keep working with hope and excitement; they are all fundamental to us," Solari is quoted as saying.

"Isco has given us a lot of joy and he has to keep doing that. He's a magnificent footballer and, now that we have lost Marcos Llorente, Javi Sanchez and Mariano, we're going to need everyone."

Real Madrid: Solari's 2019 to-do list

Santiago Solari heads into the New Year tasked with leading Real Madrid to yet another Champions League, closing the gap in LaLiga...

Close the gap between Real Madrid and the top of LaLiga

End five years without a Copa del Rey win

Carry on making history in the Champions League

Get the team playing better stuff

Tighten things up at the back

Keep Vinicius' development going apace

Get the likes of Marcelo, Asensio and Isco back to their best

Real Madrid, France dominate L'Équipe's 2018 team of the year

The newspaper has included five LaLiga players in its 2018 ideal XI, which features three members of France's World Cup-winning team.

L'Équipe's 2018 ideal XI

Jan Oblak (SVN / Atlético)

Trent Alexander-Arnold (ENG / Liverpool)
Raphael Varane (FRA / Real Madrid)
Virgil van Dijk (NED / Liverpool)
Marcelo (BRA / Real Madrid)

N'Golo Kanté (FRA / Chelsea)
Luka Modric (CRO / Real Madrid)

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/03/football/1546506092_091280.html

Werner: RB Leipzig to sell if striker rejects new contract

Bayern Munich and Real Madrid have been linked with a move for Timo Werner, with RB Leipzig ready to sell the striker if he will not sign a new deal.

RB Leipzig "cannot afford" to keep Timo Werner if he will not extend his contract with the Bundesliga club, says chief executive Oliver Mintzlaff.

Werner linked with Bayern, Real Madrid, Chelsea and Liverpool

Werner is reportedly a transfer target for Bayern Munich having hit 11 goals in the Bundesliga this season, one more than Robert Lewandowski.

The Germany striker's contract runs out in 2020 and Mintzlaff confirmed the club will consider a sale if Werner, also linked with LaLiga side Real Madrid and Premier League pair Chelsea and Liverpool, will not renew his deal.

Leipzig can't let Werner go into final year of contract, says Mintzlaff
"Of course, we have to know at the latest after the end of the season," Mintzlaff said to Kicker. "Because of course, a club like us cannot afford to go with Timo Werner into the final year of his contract.

"It's logical that such a player should be courted by clubs that have a very different sporting perspectives and different financial possibilities than we have, but as long as we evolve as a club, Champions League participation would be very helpful."

Mintzlaff added club officials have told Werner of their intentions and said everyone involved in talks had "the same understanding" of his future at the club.

Leipzig are fourth in the Bundesliga having won three of their last five matches ahead of the mid-season break.

Real Madrid put on alert as Eriksen contract talks stall


The Danish midfielder has yet to reply to Tottenham's first offer and Pochettino has voiced his concern that a deal has not be reached to renew the player's contract.

London-based clubs are having problems getting their star players to renew their contracts amid the threat of more appetizing offers from Europe's top sides. There has been no advances in Eden Hazard's talks to renew with Chelsea and at Tottenham, it's the same situation with Christian Eriksen. Like Hazard, Eriksen will be out of contract in 2020 and while Spurs have made the first move to strike a new agreement, The Evening Standard report that the Danish midfielder has yet to respond. Real Madrid and Barcelona are following the case with interest.

replies.msg:
Thibault Courtois responds after Real Madrid drop more points


Los Blancos' goalkeeper spoke after the postponed match against Villarreal, amid more question marks about the credentials of Solari's side.

Thibaut Courtois spoke to Spanish station Movistar Partidazo after Real Madrid's "disappointing" draw against Villarreal on Thursday evening, saying he regretted not having started the new year with a victory.

More dropped points for Madrid

The Belgian goalkeeper's feelings about the 2-2 draw in the rearranged match was tied to the missed chances at the other end of the pitch:

"We are disappointed. We didn't have to draw that game today. We had chances to finish the match but we didn't take them. We were careless at the back, Santi [Cazorla] was left alone at the far post," he explained.

"We had long periods of possession, and created chances, not many but more than them [Villarreal], and they have not caused us much danger. We had control of the game, and we shouldn't have lost points here."

Club World Cup impact

Regarding the Club World Cup, Courtois didn't believe playing away in Abu Dhabi had a negative influence on the team's performance.

"No, I don't think so. We have trained very well recently and everyone was ready for today. We started badly, I made a save in the third minute, they then scored. We recovered quickly and scored two goals, and we also missed two one-on-ones. That was the game."

"Today's match was there to be won, now we're cut off again. We have to now be prepared for Real Sociedad on Sunday."

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/03/football/1546555506_746796.html

Who should have been marking Cazorla at the equaliser? Isco, Ramos or Marcelo?


Villarreal stunned Real Madrid in the final 10 minutes of their Thursday night meeting at the Estadio de la Ceramica, with Santi Cazorla scoring his second of the night at the back post to earn a 2-2 draw.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/04/5c2e997fe5fdeaeb2c8b45a6.html

Solari: Isco was great in the second half


Real Madrid dropped two points away at Villarreal on Thursday night, but Santiago Solari was impressed by Isco when he came on.

The Spaniard replaced the injured Gareth Bale at half time and his coach was pleased with the performance, even if Los Blancos let their lead slip in the second half.

"He went off with an overload and couldn't continue," he said of the Welshman's injury.

"[Isco] was really good.

"I am very happy with his performance as he had a great second half."

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/04/5c2e9696e5fdea31708b45d1.html

Andujar: There was no penalty from Ramos on Chukwueze, it was a tussle


Villarreal appealed for a penalty in the final minute of the first half of their Thursday night clash with Real Madrid, but they weren't award a spot kick by referee Pablo Gonzalez Fuertes.

Samuel Chukwueze was under pressure from Sergio Ramos, but there was no reason to point to the spot.

"It should be considered as a struggle with Sergio Ramos, so it was the correct decision from the Asturian official," MARCA's refereeing expert Andujar Oliver stated.

"Since it was a matter of interpretation, the referee didn't consult VAR."

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/03/5c2e848ce5fdea87508b459c.html

Emery denies Arsenal want Real Madrid's Keylor Navas


Real Madrid goalkeeper Keylor Navas has been linked with Arsenal, but Unai Emery has denied interest in the Costa Rica international.

Goalkeeper position covered at Arsenal

Emery, though, said that was not the case as he believes Leno, Cech and Emiliano Martínez offer plenty of strength in depth. "Not true," Emery told reporters of the Navas rumours ahead of an FA Cup third-round trip to Blackpool. Pressed on if Arsenal were keen on Navas, he added: "I don’t know. We never speak about one goalkeeper because I think – and it's true – we are very happy with the three goalkeepers we have now. We've never spoken about Keylor Navas."

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/03/football/1546528798_330287.html

Marcelo's defensive intensity has dropped and his initiative in attack is also missing with the best version of the Brazilian a distant memory.

Marcelo is once again being pointed out as a weak point after Real Madrid's draw with Villarreal on Thursday night. Chukwueze's aggressive dribbling down the left-hand side subdued the left-back and the Nigerian was creator-in-chief of Santi Cazorla's opening goal leaving Marcelo in his wake, which came after an early strike on Courtois by the winger; an opening five minutes to forget for the Brazilian.

The 30-year-old has slackened on the defensive side of the ball but his lack of initiative going forward is hurting Real Madrid too. He is also less competitive in tackles, getting into just 7.63 duels per game. That figure is far lower than he ever acrued under Zinedine Zidane and he is also recovering less possessions per 90 minutes with 4.45 in the league (this rises to 4.8 in the Champions League). Under Zidane he was recovering over six per 90. His lack of intensity has resulted in goals against Girona, Athletic, Sevilla, Eibar and CSKA Moscow with plenty more shaky moments that have left Real Madrid short at the back.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/04/football/1546600151_543139.html

Mijatovic: Bale has no quality to be the leader of Real Madrid


Pedja Mijatovic, who played for Real Madrid between 1996 and 1999, has admitted that while he likes Gareth Bale as a player, he is not the leader that Los Blancos need.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/04/5c2f42b7e5fdeac1798b4596.html

Real Madrid, back where they were when Lopetegui was sacked


Just over two months after Julen Lopetegui was dismissed, Solari's team remain where they were then - seven points adrift of Barcelona in the league table.

Last night's draw in Vila-real wasn't how Real Madrid had hoped to start the New Year. Solari's team looked jumbled and devoid of self-belief - it's as though they themselves know something's missing. The result leaves Madrid exactly where they were when Julen Lopetegui was handed his marching orders following the 5-1 defeat at Camp Nou in Week 10 - seven points behind Barcelona in the standings.

Madrid stagnate in the league

In the 67 days since Lopetegui's dismissal, Madrid's league campaign has yet to get off the ground. Under Solari, the team have played 14 games in all competitions - the same as under Lopetegui's reign and while they've been doing well in Cup competitions, in LaLiga they are no better than Julen's Madrid or even Zidane's before him. So far, for the six wins, two draws and six defeats which Lopetegui's Madrid registered, Solari's team have 11 victories, one draw and two defeats in all competitions.

Of course some things have improved under the Argentinean - but not enough to revive Madrid's league campaign. And it's not for poor decision-making or not trying out new strategies - Solari has decided on Courtois over Keylor, given Odriozola and Reguilón more prominence, gradually started introducing Vinicius, punished the under-performing and ineffective Isco and Asensio and rewarded Lucas for all of his hard work... but in spite of all that, the team's still dropping points. And with all of those factors it's nigh on impossible to win the league.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/04/football/1546607338_865898.html

Urgent revolution at Real Madrid: Sign an elite coach and world class players


The Santiago Bernabeu is empty, Real Madrid are disappointing more than ever, the squad has no stars willing to step up, the play is boring, and the optimism is dying; despite three consecutive Champions League trophies, Los Blancos need a revolution.

First of all, an elite head coach with a clear vision is required. The void in the post-Zidane and post-Cristiano era is evident. The policy of signing young players is no good, either. It is time for Madrid to put the club in the hands of a top coach with a project; and it is clear that Santiago Solari is not the man to do this.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/opinion/2019/01/04/5c2f4bd0e5fdeaa7798b4577.html

Real Madrid are waiting to discover the extent of Bale's injury


Real Madrid returned to training on Friday morning after their disappointing setback against Villarreal and they were without Gareth Bale, who had to come off in the 2-2 draw with an injury and they are waiting to discover the extent of his layoff.

The Welshman suffered an injury in the soleus of his left leg and is almost definitely ruled out for the match against Real Sociedad on Sunday, while it is expected that he will miss further games due to the knock.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/04/5c2f63fee5fdea924c8b45ff.html

TOP STORY: Real Madrid, Barcelona to beat Man United to Koulibaly?

Napoli defender Kalidou Koulibaly recently said 'see you soon, bro' to Paul Pogba, sparking wild transfer speculation that he was about to sign for Manchester United. But could the pair be set to meet up at a different club?

Naples-based paper Il Mattino reports that Barcelona and Real Madrid are now interested in Koulibaly (to add to their previous interest in Pogba) and have jumped ahead of United in the pecking order.

What has happened to the real Marcelo?


It has not been Marcelo's season so far and though we are yet to reach the halfway point of the campaign, the Brazilian has not been his usual self and still appears to need time to find his stride this term.

Injuries have played their part and prevented him from featuring in six LaLiga Santander games, two Champions League matches and two in the Copa del Rey, limiting him to just 16 games so far.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/04/5c2f6550e5fdea94738b45d8.html

Real Madrid's Benzema hits out at L'Équipe over shortlist absence

Karim Benzema took aim at L'Équipe on social media after being left off the newspaper's nominees for its 2018 team of the year.

"Am I maybe 16th?" quips Benzema
Taking to Instagram with a screenshot of the nominees, the 31-year-old Frenchman wrote: "Hey L'Équipe, my friends. Am I maybe 16th?"

His post quickly generated heated online debate, with opinion divided over whether his absence was, as some said, logical, or, according to others, "crazy".


https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/04/football/1546606732_961562.html

This Madrid team cannot stage comebacks

Real Madrid have not won a game in which they started from behind since August 26 against Girona (4-1), failing to turn the final scoreboard around on nine occasions since that game.

This season Real Madrid have lost a quality that has been one of the club’s trademarks: the dogged ability to win a game after going behind, a true sign of their capacity for resilience in the face of adversity.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/04/football/1546615302_733091.html

Pepe, close to being reunited with Iker Casillas at Porto


Portuguese daily 'Récord' reports today that the former Real Madrid centre-back, now a free agent after a spell in Turkey, could return to his first European club.

According to reports in today's edition of Portuguese daily Récord, Pepe is very close to returning to Porto - the club where he began his career at the top level and from where he joined Real Madrid in 2007. If all goes to plan he will find himself reunited with an old team mate from his Bernabéu days, Iker Casillas - both were part of the Madrid defence from 2007 to 2015 when the keeper left for Estádio do Dragão.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/04/football/1546624240_770047.html

Real Madrid have no time to look back and return to training


Real Madrid were afforded no time to lick their wounds after dropping yet more points on the road at Villarreal on Thursday night, as the squad were back in training on Friday morning to prepare for their LaLiga Santander clash with Real Sociedad on Sunday.

La Real will visit the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu with hopes of inflicting more pain on Los Blancos, with the two to face off at 18:30 CET.

Karim Benzema, Raphael Varane, Lucas Vazquez, Isco and Casemiro were all jogging on the pitches while Marco Asensio, Marcos Llorente and Mariano Diaz continued their recoveries.

It was also revealed on Friday that Gareth Bale faces two weeks out with injury.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/04/5c2faa1ae5fdea8a558b461c.html

Real Madrid set to make formal offer for Palacios, says agent

Renato Corsi revealed a transfer to send the River Plate midfielder to the Blancos is at an advanced stage

“The leaders of River got together with Real Madrid in Abu Dhabi,” Corsi told La Oral Deportiva de Radio Rivadavia.

“In the coming days there will be a formal offer and the operation is quite advanced.

”The family, Exequiel and I want him to go in June and Real Madrid don‘t have a problem with him staying at River until then.“

Corsi added: ”Real Madrid want him and supposedly River will sell. They agree, so between Monday and Tuesday the formal proposal will be presented.“

replies.msg:
Yet another injury at Real Madrid as Javi Sanchez is ruled out

Real Madrid's misfortune with injuries has carried into 2019 and spread into Castilla, with Javi Sanchez becoming the latest to fall.

The defender had become a regular in Santiago Solari's squads and he was set to play for Castilla this weekend, though an injury has him ruled out for three weeks.

This is now the 30th injury at the club this season.

In 2018, Real Madrid's players suffered 43 injuries in all.

Solari: Real Madrid shouldn't undervalue draws

Santi Cazorla's brace condemned Real Madrid to their third LaLiga Santander draw of the 2018/19 season, yet coach Santiago Solari believes that these results shouldn't be undervalued.

"It's a very competitive league, we shouldn't undervalue draws," Solari explained in his pre-match press conference on Saturday morning.

"We have one of the most beautiful leagues, every single team plays and everyone has the talent to hurt any opponent.

"Obviously, we want to win, but we had a good first half against Villarreal and will now try and take all three points on Sunday."

DIAZ DEAL CLOSE

Brahim Diaz is on the brink of completing his move from Manchester City to Real Madrid, for a fee that could rise as high as £22m.

Sky Sports News understand Real will pay an initial £15.5m, with add-ons that could be worth a further £6.5m. The Spanish winger is in the final 6 months of his contract and rejected the offer of a new deal to stay in Manchester.

Sources at Man City have told us that while they would have liked the Academy graduate to stay, they understand why he has made the decision to return to his homeland to play for one of the biggest clubs there.

In addition to the initial £15.5m fee, Man City will also benefit from any future transfer, with an intriguing clause inserted into the deal that seems to be designed to scupper their rivals across town. If Diaz leaves Real, Man City will get 15 per cent profit on any sale - unless he is sold to a "club in Manchester" when the percentage of the profit will rise to 40 per cent.

Villarreal planned to target Marcelo ahead of Real Madrid clash

It's no secret that Marcelo's defensive work isn't his shining attribute, and Villarreal coach Luis Garcia created a game plan to target the Brazilian ahead of the midweek draw with Real Madrid.

Samuel Chukwueze has been one of the revelations of the LaLiga Santander season, and Garcia positioned the Nigerian on the right flank by in order to fully exploit Marcelo's defensive frailties.

"Real Madrid have many great strengths, far more than flaws, but we worked to create specific problems for them," Garcia explained in his post-match interview in the mixed zone.

"Marcelo is alongside Jordi Alba, the best attacking player [in his position] in the world, but going backwards..."

Iker Casillas rues Three Kings' gift from 30 years ago


January 5 is hugely important in Spanish culture as the day of the Festival of the Three Magic Kings, and 30 years ago Iker Casillas made his own plea to receive a specific gift.

This request was to fall on deaf ears as thePorto goalkeeper made clear on his social media pages on Saturday morning, with an image depicting the gift he did want, a Scalextric set, and the one he actually received, a far more primitive racing game.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/01/05/5c30a2bf268e3efd7f8b456f.html

Solari makes mathematical error


Real Madrid's draw with Villarreal was a result the club could ill-afford in the title race, and coach Santiago Solari continued a disappointing week by making a calculation error in his press conference on Saturday morning.

"Nobody has less holiday than us," he said.

This isn't strictly true, despite the European champions this season playing 28 matches by January 5.

Sevilla began their campaign earlier than anybody else in Spain, and as a result of their participation in the qualification rounds of the Europa League the Andalusian club has racked up 32 matches already, four more than their counterparts from the Spanish capital.

Real Madrid will pay 17 million euros up front for Brahim Diaz

Brahim Diaz will arrive in Spain on Saturday to become a Real Madrid player, arriving from Manchester City.

Signing for six-and-a-half seasons, Diaz will be presented at the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu on Monday if all goes to plan.

Madrid will pay an initial 17 million euros for the winger, plus potentially a further 7 million euros in bonuses, while City will receive 15 percent of any transfer fee should Madrid subsequently sell Diaz, according to The Telegraph.

The newspaper also reported that Madrid would have to give City 40 percent of the sale value should Diaz be sold to Manchester United, though the European champions deny this clause's existence.

An official announcement could arrive as early as Saturday, with the clubs having agreed terms after negotiating the deal due to the player's reluctance to remain in Manchester until his contract expired in June.

Brahim Díaz to Real Madrid: all the details of Man City transfer

The 19-year-old Málaga-born midfielder will put pen to paper on a six-and-a-half year deal running until 2025 at the Bernabéu with Real paying €15m plus add-ons.

Real Madrid are planning to unveil Brahim Díaz as their first January signing next week and the 19-year-old midfielder could complete his move as early as Monday with the final small print on his transfer from Manchester City being hammered out over the weekend.

Díaz, who joined City from Málaga in 2015, is expected to sign a six-and-a-half year deal at the Bernabéu running up to 2025 with Madrid paying a fee of 15 million euros up front with an additional five million in add-ons for one of the most sought-after young footballers in Europe. The Madrid board decided to take the opportunity to act with Díaz out of contract in June and available on a free, with City happy to facilitate the deal in order to bank a considerable profit on a player who cost them 200,000 euros rather than lose him on a free next summer.

City insert "anti-Manchester United" clause in Díaz's Madrid deal

Díaz has made it plain that he would prefer to leave the Etihad with opportunities at a premium for the teenager in a squad that contains a wealth of talent in his position. According to reports in the UK, City have inserted two clauses in the deal: a sell-on fee of 15 percent for any future transfer and an “anti-Manchester United clause” that would require Madrid to pay the Premier League club 40 percent of any transfer income generated by the player moving to Old Trafford. However, sources close to the negotiations have told As that no such clause exists.

Real Madrid are hoping to present Díaz next week and the midfielder will likely be handed the number 21 shirt vacated by Borja Mayoral when the striker moved to Levante on loan.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/01/05/football/1546705266_273134.html

Real Madrid continue to prepare for their LaLiga Santander meeting with Real Sociedad and in a surprising move, Jorge De Frutos joined in with the first team's training session.

Suspension rules De Frutos out of Castilla action this weekend and, as a result, Santiago Solari allowed him to train with the first team as he made up the numbers, with the squad continuing to be plagued by injuries.

Real Madrid: Bale's injury hands Isco a shot at redemption


The Welshman's injury, which will keep him sidelined for two to four weeks, and that of Marco Asensio has opened the door for the forgotten man to make a statement.

Real Madrid’s 2-2 draw against Villarreal cast fresh clouds over the Bernabéu but there is one player who will have seen a shaft of light appear after the game: Gareth Bale’s latest injury has opened the door for Isco to stake a claim for more regular playing time under Santiago Solari with the midfielder coming in from the cold in the Estadio de la Cerámica.

Isco has been relegated to the bench for most of Solari’s reign to date, and failed to make it that far in the Champions League match against Roma, playing the full 90 minutes just twice under the Argentinean in the Copa del Rey stroll against Melilla and CSKA in Europe in a game that had little consequence with Madrid already qualified for the knock-out stages.

Solari has been more inclined to use Lucas Vázquez ahead of Isco and Marco Asensio but the latter’s injury coupled with that of Bale, who is expected to be out for two to four weeks, has handed the 26-year-old playmaker a chance to work his way back into the Real boss’ plans. In Villarreal he did his case little harm with an impressive 45-minute cameo and he will have further chances with Madrid facing a glut of games in the next few weeks.

Eriksen: Real Madrid confident deal for Dane can be levied


The "special undertanding" with Tottenham has been of use to Real in the past and the club is eyeing a move for the midfielder, whose contract expires in 2020.

Real Madrid’s dealings with Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy have rarely been straightforward but in the past have borne fruit that has tasted as sweet on both sides of the English channel, in the cases of Luka Modric and Gareth Bale. Florentino Pérez has been satisfied by getting his way, while Levy, a notorious hard-baller, has stuffed Spurs’ coffers with more cash than might reasonably have been expected at the time for two of his star players.

The Bernabéu’s tentative sounding-out of Mauricio Pochettino may have been met with a brick wall, the Argentinean being the foundation stone of Tottenham’s recent success, but Pérez is ready to go back to his favourite hunting ground for another of Levy’s prized assets next summer: Christian Eriksen.
